messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Fwd: Frozen in Grand Central Station!
messages.msgSnippet: I read my e-mail backwards and rejected a post because it just looked like mystery-spam. So here it is. But please, please--cross-posts aren t the greatest use
messages.messageBody:
I read my e-mail backwards and rejected a post because it just looked
like mystery-spam.
So here it is.

But please, please--cross-posts aren't the greatest use of lists.
Some people are on three or four unschooling lists and so they got
this three or four times. I'd like for AlwaysLearning to be so
special that when people post here it's because they're on the list
and thought the thing they've just written would be good for this list.

If you send a link, please put some thoughtful commentary on why it's
good for unschoolers to consider, if you can.


FROM: wbmscm@...
DATE: Thu, 28 Feb 2008 20:05:52 -0500
SUBJECT: Re: [SPAM] [AlwaysLearning] Fwd: Frozen in Grand Central
Station!

They were on the Today show (or one of the other morning
shows a few weeks ago). Local groups are being formed here
http://improveverywhere.ning.com/

And make sure you check out their latest mission at
http://improveverywhere.com/ . A few agents go to starbucks
with their giant desktop computers to work...rofl. ,_._,___

-- Peace, Wendy

messages.subject: RE: [SPAM] [AlwaysLearning] Fwd: Frozen in Grand Central Station!
messages.msgSnippet: That was Improv   Everywhere. They are very cool. If you liked that, you should check out some of their other
messages.messageBody:
That was Improv <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Improv_Everywhere> Everywhere. They are very cool. If you liked that, you should check out some of their other missions <http://improveverywhere.com/missions/> too. I first heard about them on a This American Life episode in 2005, which itself was excellent btw.



Ken

~Kelly
